metadata.description: Curated database of Old Testament types and their New Testament antitypes
metadata.note: Typology shows how OT figures, events, and institutions prefigure Christ and the Church

type.name: Adam
type.description: The first man, created in God's image, who fell through disobedience

antitype.name: Christ - The Second Adam
antitype.description: Christ reverses Adam's fall through obedience unto death

types.connection: As death came through one man (Adam), life comes through one man (Christ). Adam's disobedience brought condemnation; Christ's obedience brings justification.

church_fathers.author: Irenaeus
church_fathers.quote: Christ recapitulated in Himself the long history of mankind, summing up and giving us salvation.

church_fathers.author: Augustine
church_fathers.quote: The first Adam was made a living soul; the last Adam a quickening spirit.

type.name: Isaac's Near-Sacrifice
type.description: Abraham's willingness to sacrifice his only beloved son, who carries the wood up the mountain

antitype.name: Christ's Crucifixion
antitype.description: God gives His only begotten Son, who carries His cross up Golgotha

types.connection: Abraham's willingness prefigures God the Father's gift. Isaac carrying wood up Moriah prefigures Christ carrying the cross. The ram caught in thorns points to Christ crowned with thorns.

church_fathers.author: Origen
church_fathers.quote: Isaac himself carrying the wood for the holocaust is a figure of Christ, for He bore His own cross.

church_fathers.author: Augustine
church_fathers.quote: Who was that ram but Jesus, who before He was offered up was crowned with Jewish thorns?

type.name: Passover Lamb
type.description: Unblemished lamb whose blood on doorposts saves Israel from the angel of death

antitype.name: Christ - The Lamb of God
antitype.description: Christ's blood saves believers from eternal death

types.connection: The lamb must be without blemish (Christ sinless). No bone broken (fulfilled at crucifixion). Blood applied for salvation (appropriation of Christ's sacrifice).

church_fathers.author: Chrysostom
church_fathers.quote: Christ is called our Passover because He was slain for us, and His blood protects us.

church_fathers.author: Justin Martyr
church_fathers.quote: The mystery of the lamb which God commanded to be sacrificed as the Passover was a type of Christ.

type.name: Moses
type.description: Deliverer of Israel, lawgiver, mediator between God and people

antitype.name: Christ - The Greater Moses
antitype.description: Christ delivers from sin, gives new law, and is the perfect mediator

types.connection: Moses delivered Israel from Egypt; Christ delivers from sin. Moses gave manna; Christ is the bread of life. Moses mediated the old covenant; Christ mediates the new.

church_fathers.author: Origen
church_fathers.quote: Moses was a type of Christ, leading the people out of bondage as Christ leads us from the bondage of sin.

church_fathers.author: Cyril of Alexandria
church_fathers.quote: What Moses began in figure, Christ completed in truth.

type.name: Manna from Heaven
type.description: Miraculous bread from heaven that sustained Israel in the wilderness

antitype.name: Christ - The Bread of Life / Eucharist
antitype.description: Christ is the true bread from heaven that gives eternal life

types.connection: Manna sustained physical life temporarily; Christ gives eternal life. Manna came daily; Christ's grace is renewed daily. The Eucharist continues this mystery.

church_fathers.author: Augustine
church_fathers.quote: They ate manna; we eat Another. But they in symbol; we in reality.

church_fathers.author: Cyril of Jerusalem
church_fathers.quote: In the Old Testament there was the showbread; now there is the Bread of Life. Then there was manna; now the True Manna.

type.name: Bronze Serpent
type.description: Moses lifted up a bronze serpent; those bitten who looked upon it were healed

antitype.name: Christ Lifted Up on Cross
antitype.description: Christ lifted up on the cross brings healing to all who look upon Him in faith

types.connection: Jesus explicitly makes this connection in John 3:14. As looking at the serpent brought physical healing, looking to Christ in faith brings spiritual salvation.

church_fathers.author: Justin Martyr
church_fathers.quote: This sign was given for the destruction of the power of the serpent, and for the salvation of those who believe.

church_fathers.author: Augustine
church_fathers.quote: By the serpent understand death; by the serpent lifted up, the Lord's death on the cross.

type.name: Jonah in the Fish
type.description: Jonah spent three days and nights in the belly of the great fish

antitype.name: Christ's Death and Resurrection
antitype.description: Christ in the tomb three days before resurrection

types.connection: Jesus explicitly cites this as the only sign He would give. Three days in the fish = three days in the tomb. Jonah's emergence = Christ's resurrection.

church_fathers.author: Jerome
church_fathers.quote: As Jonah spent three days in the whale's belly, so Christ spent three days in the heart of the earth.

church_fathers.author: Tertullian
church_fathers.quote: Jonah served as a type of the Lord's passion.

type.name: King David
type.description: The shepherd-king of Israel, chosen by God, promised an eternal throne

antitype.name: Christ - Son of David, King of Kings
antitype.description: Christ fulfills the Davidic covenant as the eternal King

types.connection: David was a shepherd who became king; Christ is the Good Shepherd and King. The promise to David of an eternal throne is fulfilled in Christ's eternal reign.

church_fathers.author: Augustine
church_fathers.quote: David in all things was a figure of Christ: in his anointing, his trials, his victories, his kingdom.

church_fathers.author: Eusebius
church_fathers.quote: The promises made to David find their ultimate fulfillment not in Solomon but in Christ.

type.name: Noah's Ark
type.description: The vessel that saved Noah's family and animals from the flood

antitype.name: The Church / Baptism
antitype.description: The Church as the ark of salvation; baptism as passing through the waters

types.connection: As the ark saved through water, baptism now saves. One door into the ark; one way into the Church. Eight souls saved; new creation begins.

church_fathers.author: Cyprian
church_fathers.quote: Outside the ark of Noah no one was saved; outside the Church no one is saved.

church_fathers.author: Augustine
church_fathers.quote: The ark signifies the Church sailing through the floods of time.

type.name: Melchizedek
type.description: King of Salem and priest of God Most High who blessed Abraham with bread and wine

antitype.name: Christ - Priest Forever
antitype.description: Christ is priest forever after the order of Melchizedek, not Levi

types.connection: Both king and priest (unique). Offers bread and wine (Eucharistic prefigurement). Without recorded genealogy (eternal priesthood). Greater than Abraham (greater than Levitical priests).

church_fathers.author: Clement of Alexandria
church_fathers.quote: Melchizedek, king of righteousness, offered bread and wine, sanctified food, as a type of the Eucharist.

church_fathers.author: Ambrose
church_fathers.quote: Who is the King of righteousness and peace? No one is this but Christ.

type.name: Joseph
type.description: Rejected by brothers, sold for silver, later exalted to save many lives

antitype.name: Christ - Rejected and Exalted
antitype.description: Christ was rejected, sold for silver, and exalted to save all who come to Him

types.connection: Sold by brothers for silver (Judas). Falsely accused (Jesus before Sanhedrin). Exalted to right hand of power. What was meant for evil, God used for good (the cross).

church_fathers.author: Ambrose
church_fathers.quote: Joseph, sold into Egypt, is a type of Christ sold by Judas.

church_fathers.author: Ephrem the Syrian
church_fathers.quote: Joseph saved his brothers who sold him; Christ saves all who crucified Him.

type.name: The Temple
type.description: The dwelling place of God's presence among His people

antitype.name: Christ's Body / The Church
antitype.description: Christ's body is the true temple; believers are living stones

types.connection: God's presence dwelt in the Temple; the fullness of deity dwells in Christ bodily. The temple had a veil; Christ's flesh was torn. We become temples of the Holy Spirit.

church_fathers.author: Origen
church_fathers.quote: Christ spoke of the temple of His body, which was to be destroyed and raised in three days.

church_fathers.author: Augustine
church_fathers.quote: The temple was His body, in which dwelt the fullness of the Godhead.

type.name: The Exodus
type.description: Israel's deliverance from slavery in Egypt through the Red Sea

antitype.name: Salvation in Christ / Baptism
antitype.description: Deliverance from bondage to sin; baptism as passing through the waters

types.connection: Bondage in Egypt = bondage to sin. Passover blood = Christ's blood. Crossing the sea = baptism. Wilderness journey = Christian life. Promised land = heaven.

church_fathers.author: Origen
church_fathers.quote: The crossing of the Red Sea is a figure of baptism; Pharaoh is the devil who pursues.

church_fathers.author: Gregory of Nyssa
church_fathers.quote: What the history teaches us is clear: that those who pass through the water of salvation must put to death the tyrant who pursues.

type.name: The Sabbath Rest
type.description: God's rest on the seventh day; Israel commanded to keep the Sabbath

antitype.name: Eternal Rest in Christ
antitype.description: Christ offers true rest; the eternal Sabbath in heaven

types.connection: The weekly Sabbath pointed to the eternal rest. Christ is Lord of the Sabbath. We enter God's rest through faith. Sunday worship celebrates resurrection.

church_fathers.author: Augustine
church_fathers.quote: The seventh day is ourselves when we are full of God's blessing and refreshment.

church_fathers.author: Jerome
church_fathers.quote: The true Sabbath is when our hearts are at rest in Christ.

type.name: The High Priest
type.description: The one who enters the Holy of Holies once a year to make atonement

antitype.name: Christ - Our Great High Priest
antitype.description: Christ entered the heavenly sanctuary once for all with His own blood

types.connection: Aaron entered yearly; Christ once for all. Blood of animals; Christ's own blood. Earthly tabernacle; heavenly sanctuary. Temporary covering; eternal redemption.

church_fathers.author: Chrysostom
church_fathers.quote: Our High Priest is not one who cannot sympathize with our weaknesses.

church_fathers.author: Cyril of Alexandria
church_fathers.quote: Christ is both priest and sacrifice, altar and offering.

type.name: The Scapegoat
type.description: On Day of Atonement, one goat is sacrificed, another carries sins into wilderness

antitype.name: Christ Bears Our Sins Away
antitype.description: Christ both dies for our sins and carries them away forever

types.connection: Sins laid on the scapegoat; our sins laid on Christ. Sent outside the camp; Christ crucified outside the city. Sins removed completely; as far as east from west.

church_fathers.author: Tertullian
church_fathers.quote: One goat was offered for sins, the other sent away - both were Christ.

church_fathers.author: Cyril of Alexandria
church_fathers.quote: The goat that was sent away into the wilderness bore the type of Christ.

type.name: Water from the Rock
type.description: Moses strikes the rock and water flows for the thirsty Israelites

antitype.name: Christ - The Rock / Living Water
antitype.description: Christ is the rock that was struck; from Him flows living water (the Spirit)

types.connection: Paul explicitly says 'that rock was Christ.' Christ struck on cross; water flows from His side. He gives living water - the Holy Spirit.

church_fathers.author: Augustine
church_fathers.quote: That rock was Christ, prefiguring Christ who was to be struck with a rod, that is, the cross.

church_fathers.author: Origen
church_fathers.quote: The rock followed them, for Christ accompanies His people.

type.name: Elijah
type.description: The great prophet who called Israel to repentance and was taken up to heaven

antitype.name: John the Baptist (in Elijah's spirit) / Christ
antitype.description: John came in the spirit of Elijah; Christ also compared to Elijah

types.connection: Malachi prophesied Elijah's return. John fulfilled this in ministry and spirit. Both called people to repentance. Both confronted corrupt rulers.

church_fathers.author: Jerome
church_fathers.quote: John was Elijah because he came in the spirit and power of Elijah.

church_fathers.author: Chrysostom
church_fathers.quote: As Elijah prepared for the first coming, so Elijah will prepare for the second.

type.name: Ruth the Moabitess
type.description: A Gentile who left her people to join Israel and married Boaz the kinsman-redeemer

antitype.name: The Gentile Church / Christ as Kinsman-Redeemer
antitype.description: Gentiles grafted into Israel; Christ as our kinsman-redeemer

types.connection: Ruth left her gods for the true God (Gentile conversion). Boaz redeems her inheritance (Christ redeems us). From this union comes David, then Christ.

church_fathers.author: Jerome
church_fathers.quote: Ruth, being of Gentile origin, signifies the Church gathered from the Gentiles.

church_fathers.author: Ambrose
church_fathers.quote: Boaz is a figure of Christ who redeemed the Church, His bride.

type.name: Joshua
type.description: Moses' successor who led Israel into the Promised Land

antitype.name: Jesus - Who Leads Us to Heaven
antitype.description: Jesus (same name as Joshua) leads us into the true rest

types.connection: The names Joshua and Jesus are the same (Yeshua = 'salvation'). Moses (Law) could not enter; Joshua leads in. Christ brings us where the Law could not.

church_fathers.author: Origen
church_fathers.quote: Joshua, whose name is the same as Jesus, was a type of our Savior.

church_fathers.author: Justin Martyr
church_fathers.quote: He who led the people into the land was named Jesus, not by chance but by providence.

type.name: Creation
type.description: God creates the heavens and earth, bringing order from chaos

antitype.name: New Creation in Christ
antitype.description: In Christ we are new creations; ultimately a new heavens and new earth

types.connection: 'In the beginning' (Genesis) echoes in John 1. The Spirit hovers over waters; the Spirit regenerates. Six days of work, seventh rest; resurrection on the eighth day (new creation).

church_fathers.author: Irenaeus
church_fathers.quote: Christ recapitulates all things in Himself, making the new creation.

church_fathers.author: Augustine
church_fathers.quote: The old has passed away; behold, the new has come. This is the true creation.

sacrifice_blood.summary: From Abel's offering through the Levitical system, blood sacrifice points to Christ's once-for-all atonement.

covenant_progression.summary: Each covenant builds toward the New Covenant in Christ's blood.

temple_presence.summary: God progressively dwells more intimately with His people, culminating in eternal presence.

progression.description: Seed of the woman will crush the serpent
In Abraham's seed, all nations blessed
Scepter will not depart from Judah

promised_seed.summary: The promise narrows from humanity to woman to Abraham to Judah to David to Jesus.
